fields.description:
Hello,\\
I use the nextgen-gallery for my homepage, but since the last update I have a bug.\\
I can't work on my pages or posts while the plugin is activated. This message is shown:

Fatal error: Allowed memory size of 67108864 bytes exhausted (tried to allocate 491520 bytes) in /www/htdocs/w00eb917/csv/wp-content/plugins/nextgen-gallery/admin/manage-images.php on line 488

if I deactivate the plugin, work on my page and activate it again everything works fine, but I think that shouldn't be the normal way to work.

can you fix the problem?

greetings,\\
pia
fields.summary: Allowed memory size exhausted

fields.description:
can't create new pull request. Chrome console says "Uncaught TypeError: Cannot call method 'split' of null"\\
FF: "TypeError: a is null"\\
Attached screenshot from Opera\\
!https://www.dropbox.com/s/1ecm3ymg3lej4jk/BB_js_error.png!
fields.summary: javascript error on pull request page
hammer_development repository is broken

fields.description:
A given user should be able to get repositories' privilege which are accessible to he/she\\
without repositories' owners!\\
Currently all the privilege GETs require owners' access(password)\\
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/privileges+Endpoint\\
"Only the repository owner, a team account administrator, or an account with administrative rights on the repository can make this call. "

There is no way to get a given user's privilege on what repositories she/he have WRITE/READ/ADMIN privilege. This should be allowed using only the user's access without the repository's owner!

User case is when a user is granted "read/write/admin" on a repository but he/she didn't fork the repository. How to get its privilege against this repository without know the owner of it.
fields.summary: user's privilege: A given user should be able to get repositories' privilege which are accessible to he/she (BB-8581)

fields.description:
I can't import repo from github. Keeps on failing time after time!

No matter if is public or private.

Keep on getting this....

Your import has failed. For more information, check the log below. You can also try your import again.

00:18:00 git import for: https://github.com/TeamDIRT-Mazda/packages_apps_Calculator.git\\
00:18:00 Cloning https://github.com/TeamDIRT-Mazda/packages_apps_Calculator.git...\\
00:18:00 Done\\
00:18:00 Fixing repository permissions...\\
00:18:00 Computing repository size...\\
00:18:00 Remote Git clone failed: <class 'orochi.base.RepoError'>: 'Mazda/packages_apps_calculator' isn't a repository
fields.summary: Can't import repo from github

fields.description:
Hi. I'm using TeamCity on a build server, and I keep getting an error about being unable to pull changes from BitBucket, so I'm currently unable to build and deploy. This is in the logs: "abandoned transaction found - run hg recover!". For what it's worth, I did try to do a pretty big commit yesterday, if that makes any difference.

Is there any way for me to do this in the admin interface, or does someone else have to do it?

This is my repository: https://bitbucket.org/rjwiffen/accountsflow
fields.summary: Abandoned transaction found - run hg recover!

fields.description: It would be great if you could set the email notification options for multiple projects at once.
fields.summary: Bulk email notification configuration (BB-8547)

fields.description:
Currently, HTTPS cannot be used with custom domains (CNAMEs) because of certificate mismatch.

It would be possible for BitBucket to fix this by letting users upload their own SSL certificate (private key) and serve them afterwards through SSL SNI.
fields.summary: Allow usage of HTTPS with CNAME

fields.description:
When I try to download a .zip of my branch it says Internal server error

to reproduce:

* Go to project page
* Click on Downloads
* Then switch to Branch tab
* Click on .zip for any branch that isn't master
* Observe "Internal Server Error"

Happens of specific project pages, other project pages are fine
fields.summary: Trying to download a branch .zip (BB-8650)

fields.description:
I had an SSH key I added mistakenly as a deployment key (I didn't realize that that would be read-only). So I fixed that by removing it from the list of deployment keys, but now when I try to add that key to my account, I get the error "Someone has already registered this as a deploy key."

How can I clear this out so it will let me add the key?
fields.summary: Incorrect "Someone has already registered this as a deploy key" message.

fields.description: * [Test|https://startpage.com/do/search%3Fq%3Dhost:www.example.co.uk/%2520filetype:pdf%2520test]
fields.summary: Certainly external links do not populate

fields.description:
As BB API consumers, how can we implement a user migration when a user decides to change both his username and hit email address?

Could you add the stable ID of the user to the {{/user}} endpoint?

Without it, BB users are not satisfied using out platform with a BB account because, when such a change happens, they have to start from scratch (like new users). Github users benefit of a transparent migration feature because the Github API returns this stable ID in each profile.
fields.summary: Add a stable ID to the user endpoint when asking for profile (BB-8580)

fields.description: The read and write functions for Binary Data are no longer working properly, due to the attempted diversification into DOUBLE and FLOAT format.
fields.summary: Read Write Functions HR_grid.java

fields.description:
Bitbucket should allow to use one of the secondary email addresses for Gravatar.

Motivation:\\
I have a special email address that I use with Gravatar, different from my primary email address on Bitbucket.
fields.summary: Allow custom email address for Gravatar (BB-8585)

fields.description: I'd like the possibility to disable login with my username. My username is public, facilitating attacks on my user account, while my email address is private.
fields.summary: Disable login with username (BB-8593)

fields.description:
If type word "django"(without quotes) to search field at right corner I got 500 response from server.

b6c89f9af4f74b7eb2af18ac8b24e3ed$ca03180b47ac7090be9372517fab6a33
fields.summary: 500 when type "django" to search field

fields.description: It would be a helpful keyboard shortcut to be able to submit issue forms (or related forms) via Ctrl+Enter.  After realizing that this is possible in various windows UI applications as well as Gmail, I have realized that the ability to do so is very smooth and prevents me from needing to pick up the mouse simply to click on the "Create Issue" or "Comment" button.
fields.summary: Ctrl + Enter to submit issue forms (BB-8549)

fields.description:
These two comments:

* https://bitbucket.org/jwilk/ocrodjvu/issue/6#comment-4005334
* https://bitbucket.org/jwilk/ocrodjvu/issue/6#comment-4005511

generated notification mails with the message msg-id:

{code}
Message-ID: <issues-964630acc7914a0d4881b8f43f753ded/updated@bitbucket.org>
{code}

But [RFC 5322, §3.6.4|http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5322#section-3.6.4] reads\\
“The message identifier (msg-id) itself MUST be a globally unique identifier\\
for a message. The generator of the message identifier MUST guarantee that the msg-id is unique.”
fields.summary: duplicate Message-Id in issue comment notification mails (BB-8498)
RestructuredText mis-aligned header rendering

fields.description:
In gitk, you have the choice to ignore spaces modifications in commits.\\
This means that in the diff display lines that differs only for number of spaces and tabs are not showed as different, so that if I refactor indentation (e.g convert from tabs to spaces) I do not see the whole file as modified, but only lines modified in real code.\\
This would be wonderful to be seen, at least as an option, in your diff tool.
fields.summary: Add the ability to ignore spaces modifications in git diffs

fields.description:
The repo admin and overview page for newly created repo is a bit screwed in Chrome 26

See attachments.
fields.summary: CSS alignment issues

fields.description:
I created a fork of aseinfo/Evolution, and forked at a specific tag instead of tip,\\
There is a new fork notification on my dashboard, but when I visit my fork I get the following message:

Cloning Repository\\
Please wait a moment while we clone your repository.

It's been showing this page since yesterday, so I'm assuming the process fails somewhere.
fields.summary: Forking process never ends

fields.description: It would be a good thing if the linebreaks within commit messages would be preserved when RSS feeds ("Recent Activity") are generated.
fields.summary: Preserve linebreakes of commit messages in RSS feeds (BB-8616)

fields.description:
Rss feed (/rss/feed/) showing partial commit messages, cuts them at linebreak..

Is there some url parameter to show complete messages? Tried searching around in the wiki, but no luck.
fields.summary: Rss feed (/rss/feed/) showing partial commit messages, cuts them at linebreak (BB-8617)

fields.description: In firefox 20.0.1 on win7 64bit rss watcher addon does not show number of unread feeds. see screenshots
fields.summary: Firefox addon > unread feeds notifications does not appear

fields.description: When login through custom domain name and go to "OpenId log in". Clicked to google icon, I redirected to https://bitbucket.org/social/openid/redirect/ with CSRF error from django.
fields.summary: login on custom domain with openid

fields.description:
When Bitbucket sends a redirect it does not take into account the custom domain.

----
I setted custom domain for organization account.\\
Than I click on link https://my_domain/my_proj/changeset/my_changset, I redirected to not existing page https://my_domain/MY_ORGNAME/my_proj/commits/my_changset.\\
If I manually remove MY_ORGNAME from url - page was loaded well.
fields.summary: Redirects from a custom domain leads to a 404 (BB-8628)

fields.description:
I'm trying to create a fork of _s_cadwallader/CodeMaid_, and forked at a specific branch (_default_) instead of tip, since I only want to make changes in this branch.

There is a new fork notification on my dashboard, but when I visit my fork I get the following message:

bq. *Cloning Repository*\\
Please wait a moment while we clone your repository.


It's been showing this page for over 3 hours already, so I'm assuming the process broke somewhere.
fields.summary: Forking process stuck

fields.description:
The new notification system overhaul is nice, thanks a lot! However, I should be able to receive emails to _any_ email address I have verified, not necessarily my primary email address associated with my identity.

In short, I should be able to select a notification email address in the notifications settings.
fields.summary: Notification email (BB-8500)

fields.description:
Have some problems in repo with files and folder which named in Russian. They are broken both in online browsing repo and download and unpack source of repo. For example name of file in repo

јссоциативна€ запоминающа€ матрица с заменой/ѕатент.doc\\
and how it was on local disk\\
*А*ссоциативна*я* запоминающа*я* матрица с заменой/*п*атент.doc
fields.summary: File names in Russia are broken

fields.description: Since recently I noticed sometime commits don't appear on the Dashboard. You have to navigate to Commits to see them.
fields.summary: Commits don't always appear on Dashboard

fields.description:
I have my 'Readme.md' with some bullets (using *) under an ordered list (using 1. 2. 3.). When I see the Readme in the Overview page, the * are not rendered as a bullet list as expected.\\
I've used http://hashify.me/IyBUaXRsZQ== to try my README and it works properly there

Also mentioned in the documentation: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/Marking+up+Comments. As you can see.. not even in this ticket works:

# Step 1
# Step 2
# Step 3

* Item 2a
fields.summary: Markdown: Lists in a list are not properly shown

fields.description: If you create an issue and set someone as an assignee, they are not set as a watcher and therefore do not receive a notification unless they are subscribed to all issues for that repo.
fields.summary: Assignee is not set as watcher when creating an issue (BB-8487)

fields.description:
When we add a new group, it is painful to have to access each repository and remove that newly created group.

An interface that quickly let you associate groups with repositories would be good, or simply do not push new groups to all repos.
fields.summary: Groups should not propagate across all repos on creation (BB-8553)

fields.description:
Hi,

one of the top features I love GitHub for (I hope you don't mind comparing you guys to GitHub) is the ability to view the commit history for a folder.

For example: https://github.com/symfony/symfony/commits/master/src/Symfony/Component/EventDispatcher

The link above displays the commit history for {{src/Symfony/Component/EventDispatcher}} folder of the repository in a way that all commits that didn't touch the folder and any items inside of it are just filtered out.

In other words, only commits that changed something inside that foder are displayed.

Since viewing commit history for a folder in git is simple as {{git log src/Symfony/Component/EventDispatcher}}, I suppose this should be trivial to implement.

Thanks for listening!
fields.summary: Add commit history on folders (BB-8483)

fields.description:
Hello,

We have a bunch of repositories under our team account.

We have added email notifications for every commit. Since today morning we are receiving a buggy email on push to some of the repositories.

Even if we push 2-3 commits at a time, the email is sent as:

0 new commits in <repository>

You might want to check this error. Please let me know if you want the repository details in order to see the logs?
fields.summary: 0 new changesets on repository

fields.description:
# User bpm opens [PR#124|https://bitbucket.org/site/master/pull-requests/124].
# User apm opens [PR#125|https://bitbucket.org/site/master/pull-requests/125].
# User apm reviews BCLOUD-124, approves.
# User bpm merges BCLOUD-124.
# User apm notices that bpm is shown as having closed both BCLOUD-124 and BCLOUD-125.  Additionally, the contents of BCLOUD-125 have been overwritten with the contents of BCLOUD-124 (the source branched changed, apparently).

I don't want to rule out user error here, but we're pretty sure we couldn't have changed the source branch of BCLOUD-125 and also merged it on accident.  It looks like a bug on Bitbucket's end.

repository: https://bitbucket.org/realityfoil/lambda\\
BCLOUD-124: https://bitbucket.org/realityfoil/lambda/pull-request/124/factor-out-inputmanager\\
BCLOUD-125: https://bitbucket.org/realityfoil/lambda/pull-request/125/refactors-column-and-voxelreference-and/diff\\
BCLOUD-126 contains the original content of BCLOUD-125: https://bitbucket.org/realityfoil/lambda/pull-request/126/column-and-voxelreference-take-2/diff

Let me know what more information would be useful.
fields.summary: Pull request somehow copied to another pull request.

fields.description:
There is some background here https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issue/7063/admin-users-have-access-to-all-forks#comment-3923785

We should encourage the workflow of keeping team repos inside the team account instead of encouraging them to fork them into their personal accounts.
fields.summary: Fork repo for a team-owned fork should default to the team account instead of the current user's account (BB-8464)

fields.description: It would be nice to be able to change the source code color scheme for my user account. Even just offering a simple light / dark option per user account would be a nice improvement.
fields.summary: Request an Alternate Dark Source Code Color Scheme

fields.description:
Since Firefox 20.0 on MacOS X popup menus don't pop up any more. With Safari everything works as expected. Tested with Firefox 20.0 with deactivated AddOns.

To reproduce, i.e. go to https://bitbucket.org/fdik/pypeg/ and click on "Followers". A popup menu with the followers should appear, but with Firefox 20.0 it doesn't, at least not on MacOS X.
fields.summary: Popup menus don't work with Mozilla Firefox 20.0 on MacOS X

fields.description:
On the Issues page, 'open' should surely be translated as 'Открытые задачи' and not as 'Открыть'. Also you could write 'Открыть задачу' instead of 'Создать задачу'. By the way, I think, 'issue' here would sound better in Russian as 'проблема' rather then as 'задача' (In summary, I suggest to write 'Проблемы' instead of 'Задачи', 'Открыть проблему' instead of 'Создать задачу', 'Открытые проблемы' instead of 'Открыть', etc.)

Also, on commit page 'Approve' can be translated as 'Подтвердить' and 'Unapprove' as 'Отменить подтверждение'.

By the way, in the message suggesting to use Russian interface, you wrote that it's beta and you need enhancements. So am I right when I post enhancement suggestions here?

(I'm a Russian native speaker, of course.)
fields.summary: Russian interface

I approve and merge his request but I got "unable to merge" message. But then, the pull request is gone, in his account the status is also approved and merged, but the changes are not reflected in my repo.

fields.description:
We have the Email Service turned on for several of our repos and occasionally will commit and push some changes, and a spooky email goes out (see copy below). We're certain changes are in the Push, but randomly the email service just sends it out as 0 commits from time to time. We've had this happen 3 times in the past few days, never had it happen prior.

commit/Stemage: 0 new changesets

From: Bitbucket\\
0 new commits in Stemage:

Repository URL: https://bitbucket.org/b9chris/stemage/

--

This is a commit notification from bitbucket.org. You are receiving\\
this because you have the service enabled, addressing the recipient of\\
this email.
fields.summary: 0 new changesets - Email Service

fields.description: See [BB-8434|https://bitbucket.atlassian.net/browse/BB-8434]
fields.summary: Email address on the notifications for issues doesn't save (BB-8434)

fields.description:
I pushed 2 Git commits to BitBucket an hour ago, and one more\\
commit a couple minutes ago.  The commit of the 2nd push shows\\
in the "Commits" tab at BitBucket, and in the "Overview" tab.

However, the 2 commits of the first push show only in the Commits\\
tab.  They are missing from the Overview tab.

See https://bitbucket.org/fredstluka/hhl

The missing commits are:

* https://bitbucket.org/fredstluka/hhl/commits/783c4ac5ce431ef7afd430ec0381961282855943
* https://bitbucket.org/fredstluka/hhl/commits/d674f06638841ff4e76894cfc64e64c0df5d4270

Seems like an odd bug.  Don't they both pull from the\\
same Git log?

--Fred
fields.summary: BitBucket "Overview" tab is missing some Git commits...

Whenever I try to change my repository image, I get a 500 error. This happens when I choose an image and try to save the repository details. The iframe changes to a 500 page, the page refreshes and shows a success message.

fields.summary: Repository image problems

fields.description:
We have a few repositories with several forks. We have the forks a few commits behind their parents, therefore we get a message like:

This fork is XXX commits behind XXXXXXX. Sync now.

Clicking on Sync now opens a dialog window to do the merge, which used to work, but now, clicking on Sync, leaves shows a wait indicator (spinner) for a short time, and then returns to the same window, without doing the sync.

This makes it impossible to sync repos using the web interface.
fields.summary: Syncing a repo which is a number of commits behind its parent freezes.

fields.description: When attempting to sync a fork with the original repo (via sync repository prompt on the forks overview page) pressing the "sync" button shows spinning activity indicator for a couple of seconds, but does not seem to actually sync the repository.
fields.summary: Can't sync upstream changes into fork through bitbucket web interface

fields.description:
As shown in the attached screenshot, I did a search for "jira-anonymiser". The search results screen said there was one result, but I can't see a link or preview for that result.

P.S. Why aren't you guys using JIRA for issue tracking? ;)
fields.summary: Search claims to have found results but no results shown (BB-8429)
Pull Request, Syncing and Merge are not working for many users (BB-8430)

fields.description: When you try to delete a branch, it may fail with error 405. This is a bug and the bitbucket team is investigating why.
fields.summary: Cannot delete a branch, get error 405 "method not allowed" (BB-8426)

fields.description: I have a custom domain mapped for my organization, say, code.newcorp.com.  I was looking at a Pull Request, and saw the indicator in the lower right that another user was also viewing the PR.  When I clicked on the user's name (say, john_doe), I was sent to code.newcorp.com/john_doe, but received a 404 instead of that user's profile page.
fields.summary: User links in pull request live update messages are wrong on CNAMEs (BB-8460)

fields.description:
I just recently started using bitbucket and am having an issue with very slow download speeds with git pull. Downloads of files through the web interface (from a repo's downloads page) are fine.

As a test, I created a repo with about 250mb (https://bitbucket.org/scottcs/speedtest). When pushing the initial commit to bitbucket, it took only 7m6.44s. I then immediately cloned the repo to a new directory, and that took 34m32.52s. For some reason the download transfer speed tops off between 90-100 KB/s. I am experiencing this slowness on both osx and windows, both using ssh and https, and on more than one bitbucket repo.

I had about 8 other people at my company clone my speedtest repo and they all had times between 2m-8m.

I first noticed the problem when trying to clone our company's repo (which is over 1GB in size). I've tried cloning from github, as well, and that is very fast.

I'm not sure how to further troubleshoot the problem, so I'd appreciate any help. Thanks.
fields.summary: very slow git pull (but not push) speeds only with bitbucket

fields.description:
Hi, I don't know if I'm at the right place for this but for quite some time now I've been having slow upload speed, currently under 10KiB/s writing objects. It makes push running for hours for relatively small size (20 MB)

Is this something I could fix on my end?  My connection speed test return ~1 638.4 Kbps (204.8 KB/s)

Thanks for your help for making me like using Bitbucket.

Mat
fields.summary: Git push slow speed

fields.description:
Here is what my project overview looks like:

!http://content.screencast.com/users/togakangaroo/folders/Jing/media/be29b4e6-9452-4d85-b7b7-0b37268c92ee/2013-05-02_1223.png!

The above is correct.

Here is what my commits page looks like:\\
!http://content.screencast.com/users/togakangaroo/folders/Jing/media/6fc57eba-917a-40dd-b878-bb6c080da99c/2013-05-02_1224.png!

Note that these are the same exact commits but its showing different users!

owhudson is a read-only account I created months ago to use with our ci server. I commit everything and am currently logged in as Geore Mauer

Multiple fixtures

fields.description:
We use namespaces to name our repositories and this can lead to some lengthy repository names such as "ZeeZor.Kiosk.Devices.PortManager" and on the dashboard when we list the repository names we only see the beginning part of the name and we have to use the "mouse over" to see the full name.  I like the fact that you allow for the repository component to be enlarged vertically when you have lots of repositories but can you also either automatically size the horizontal or allow for it to be expandable.  My preference would be to automatically size it accordingly but beggars cannot be choosers.

I attached a picture to give you an idea of what I see today.

Do you think this might be possible in a future release?

Thank you,\\
Blake
fields.summary: Better UI treatment for repos with long names in the dashboard repo list (BB-8419)

fields.description:
See screenshot.  Looks like a simple css issue.

I'm using Chrome Version 26.0.1410.63 on Ubuntu 12.04.

Thanks!
fields.summary: Empty repo overview tutorial sidebar/content columns display incorrectly when zoomed out (BB-8413)

fields.description:
For all my projects, I add a POST service (for jenkins integration)

For the WeWantToKnow/unity3d-flash-incompabilities project:

POST http://SERVER_URL/git/notifyCommit?url=git@bitbucket.org:WeWantToKnow/unity3d-flash-incompabilities.git

I would really like the ability to:

* use a parametrized URL, so that I do have to customize the URL value for each project.
* declare this service globally so that I can enter it once for the organization
fields.summary: Parametrized and global service URL (BB-8421)

Only the first 20? repositories are available when importing from github.

I have more and I want one that is alphabetically sorted at the end of the list...

fields.description:
I got this error:

error: The requested URL returned error: 407 while accessing https://<user-name>@bitbucket.org/<user-name>/<repo-name>.git/info/refs\\
fatal: HTTP request failed

where <user-name> is my user name and <repo-name> is the name of the repository. Also, I am behind a proxy. Someone give me pointers to how to proceed.
fields.summary: fatal: HTTP request failed

fields.description:
Hi,

It seems usernames in the url are case sensitive. Mine is http://www.bitbucket.org/Jeffrey and it seems http://www.bitbucket.org/jeffrey is an entirely different user.

Also whenever I add a new repository it also gives full permission to the lowercase jeffrey user in addition to my own account.

thanks!
fields.summary: Username in url case sensitive? Bug with permissions.

fields.description:
Hi,\\
When you upload (for downloading) more times a file with a certain name, the newer versions are (silently) not accepted. Instead the first version is mainteined.\\
In other words I'm forced to change the file name every time I want to upload a new version of a file.

Hope it helps,\\
Thanks\\
Vincenzo Maffione
fields.summary: Download tab - Uploading does not overwrite

fields.description:
When we commit files with Git, Bitbucket tries to guess the encoding.\\
Sometimes these guesses are not correct and it would be great if we can set the encoding within our account or repository.
fields.summary: Allow specifying a repository's encoding (for viewing files/diffs) (BB-8418)

fields.description:
It would be great if, when automatically populating a name for a pull request, git generated messages for pulls are ignored, and the first _meaningful_ message is used.

See attached file for example of what I mean.
fields.summary: Ignore git generated merge messages when guessing pull request title (BB-8422)

Richard

fields.description:
It would be helpful to have a quick way of assigning issues to the current user right on the issue detail page, without having the need to edit the ticket.

Keep up the great work!
